subject: Mathematics
question_text: Given below are two statements : Statement I : In a vernier callipers, one vernier scale division is always smaller than one main scale division. Statement II : The vernier constant is given by one main scale division 2025 (22 Jan Shift 1) JEE Main 2025 January JEE Main Previous Year Paper MathonGo m 2R O ′ F 1 R/3 F 2 F 1 : F 2 12 : 11 11 : 10 12 : 9 16 : 9 ρ 1 ρ 2 ′ 9 th 4 th ρ 1 : ρ 2 = 1 : 16 15 7 20 7 15 9 20 9 B μ 0 (B/μ 0 ) ML 2 T −2 A −1 MT −2 A −1 L −1 A LT −2 A −1 ' a ' 2 a λ ϵ 0 λa 2ϵ 0 λa 4ϵ 0 λa 16ϵ 0 λa 8ϵ 0
question_latex: Given below are two statements : Statement I : In a vernier callipers, one vernier scale division is always smaller than one main scale division. Statement II : The vernier constant is given by one main scale division 2025 (22 Jan Shift 1) JEE Main 2025 January JEE Main Previous Year Paper MathonGo m 2R O ′ F 1 $\frac{R}{3}$ F 2 F 1 : F 2 12 : 11 11 : 10 12 : 9 16 : 9 ρ 1 ρ 2 ′ 9 th 4 th ρ 1 : ρ 2 = 1 : 16 15 7 20 7 15 9 20 9 B μ 0 ($\frac{B}{μ}$ 0 ) ML 2 T −2 A −1 MT −2 A −1 L −1 A LT −2 A −1 ' a ' 2 a λ ϵ 0 λa 2ϵ 0 λa 4ϵ 0 λa 16ϵ 0 λa 8ϵ 0

options.text: (1) Statement I is true but Statement II is false
(2) Statement I is false but Statement II is true
(3) Both Statement I and Statement II are false
(4) Both Statement I and Statement II are true
